title: Fish in Foil Recipe
description: Baked fish in foil is foolproof for tender, tasty fish every time. Try it with trout and jalapenos: Flavor and juices stay in, no fishy odor leaks out!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Seafood Fish Fish in Foil 4.4 (432) 322 Reviews 31 Photos Baked fish in foil is a "no-smell" fish recipe, and the only one I make for my family (I hate fish, they love it!). Take foil packets to the table for service, and keep the packets around for wrapping and discarding bones and skin. Then when dinner's done, haul those babies to the outside trash. Submitted by Denyse Updated on June 27, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 2 rainbow trout fillets 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 teaspoons garlic salt 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 2 sheets heavy-duty aluminum foil 1 fresh jalapeno pepper, sliced 1 lemon, sliced Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Rinse and pat fillets dry. Rub fillets with olive oil, and season with garlic salt and black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place each fillet on a large sheet of aluminum foil. Top with jalapeno slices, and squeeze the juice from the ends of the lemon over fillets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange remaining lemon slices on top of fillets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Carefully seal all edges of the foil to form enclosed packets. Place packets on a baking sheet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes depending on size of fillets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 495 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 213 Calories 11g Fat 8g Carbs 24g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 213 % Daily Value * Total Fat 11g 14% Saturated Fat 2g 9% Cholesterol 67mg 22% Sodium 1850mg 80% Total Carbohydrate 8g 3% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 0g Protein 24g 49% Vitamin C 48mg 53% Calcium 117mg 9% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 663mg 14% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Fish in Foil 01 of 31 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 31 Photo by  RoRo 01/05/2023 The recipe was super easy and delicious. I tweaked it a little by using fresh diced tomatoes and red onions. I couldn’t use the jalapeños and cilantro I had, so I improvised. It turned out great my honey loved it! Personally rockfish is not the tastiest. It’s kind boring fish not tasty but the extra ingredients made the fish delicious. I also added chopped garlic. I will make this recipe with steelhead or salmon next time. Thanks for a great and easy recipe. 03 of 31 Photo by  Skirts 09/10/2019 04 of 31 Photo by  Lance 06/23/2019 05 of 31 Photo by  Robin Bungert 05/22/2019 06 of 31 Photo by  Robin Bungert 05/22/2019 07 of 31 Photo by  Mark Escobedo 03/25/2019 08 of 31 Photo by  Marc Barrak 05/30/2018 09 of 31 Photo by  Marc Barrak 05/30/2018 10 of 31 Photo by  Nina Ghazali 05/08/2018 I use this recipe but I modified a bit. I use red chilies instead of jalapeños (because I like it that spicy) and dory fish. Me and my husband love it! But I do think I need to tone down the spiciness a bit next time haha. I was too excited! 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Lemon-Orange Orange Roughy 256 Ratings Lemon Pepper Cod 170 Ratings Mediterranean-Twist Salmon 20 Ratings Light and Spicy Fish 95 Ratings Onion Salmon 21 Ratings Spinach-Stuffed Flounder with Mushrooms and Feta 159 Ratings Baked Fresh Rainbow Trout 128 Ratings Simply Swordfish 92 Ratings Sea Bass Barbecue 9 Ratings Grilled Steelhead Trout 27 Ratings Cardamom Maple Salmon 65 Ratings Tomato Basil Salmon 315 Ratings Lemon Rosemary Salmon 459 Ratings Salmon with Dill 796 Ratings Patti's Mussels a la Mariniere 343 Ratings Spicy Lime and Dill Grilled Fish 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
